title: Variable Types Interactive Infographic
creator: Claude Code with microsim-p5 skill
subject: Mathematics
Algebra
Variable Notation
description: An interactive visual guide showing four common types of algebraic variables (position, time, counting, and rate) with real-world examples and expandable content in a 2x2 grid layout.
learningObjectives: Identify four main categories of variables used in algebra (position, time, counting, rate)
Explain the typical usage context for each variable type
Recognize conventional variable naming patterns in mathematical problems
Apply appropriate variable choices when setting up equations
prerequisites: Basic understanding of variables in algebra

controls.name: Card Hover
controls.description: Hover over any of the four category cards to see expanded descriptions
controls.purpose: Provides detailed context about variable usage

controls.name: Card Click
controls.description: Click on any card to toggle expanded view with additional examples
controls.purpose: Reveals 2-3 more real-world examples for each variable type

parameters.name: Category Colors
parameters.description: Blue for position, green for time, orange for counting, purple for rate variables

parameters.name: Expanded State
parameters.description: Tracks whether each card is showing additional examples

assumptions: Variables are presented in their most common conventional usage
Examples are simplified for educational clarity
Categories represent common patterns but are not exhaustive
limitations: Does not cover all possible variable types in mathematics
Some variables can serve multiple purposes depending on context
